snippet: Greek leaders jumped into campaign mode to prepare for elections expected by early May amid voter dissatisfaction and the rise of groups on the far left and far right.
abstract: Greek leaders leap into full campaign mode to prepare for national elections; Finance Minister Evangelos Venizelos submits his formal bid for the leadership of the once-mighty Socialist Party; as the only candidate for position he is all but guaranteed to replace current leader, former Prime Min George Papandreou.

byline.original: By NIKI KITSANTONIS and RACHEL DONADIO
byline.contributor: Niki Kitsantonis reported from Athens, and Rachel Donadio from Rome.

lead_paragraph: Greek leaders jumped into campaign mode to prepare for elections expected by early May amid voter dissatisfaction and the rise of groups on the far left and far right.

headline.main: Greek Leaders Turn Focus to Preparing for Elections
headline.print_headline: Greek Leaders Turn Focus To Preparing for Elections
